objects.name: obj_notes
objects.string:
NOTES:
The background should probably always be a multiple of 1920, to make it a full screen width. 
Walls should be on the interior of the 1920 rectangle.
To add new static backgrounds, add a new animation to the "spr_decor" object, - 
and then when placing it into the scene, make its instance variable be the name of the animation. Use the clocks as reference.
Play the game in fullscreen mode. (f11)
Press f4 to close the game immediately.
Added some visual effects to the camera.
Stairs are a bit more complicated, You need 4 objects, 2 stairs and 2 interact buttons. 
(technically you don't need the buttons, but I'm going for consitency) 
You also don't technically need 2 stairs, but then its only one direction. 
To make stair pairs, if going to a new floor that isn't on the level of any other, add the y-coords for the player to be at to the global structure. 
you can get the coords by just moving the player in the editor and checking the properties panel.
Next, set a door and button id to be the same, but the the same as any other pair. Also make sure to set the animation for the staircase.

content.text:
NOTES:
The background should probably always be a multiple of 1920, to make it a full screen width. 
Walls should be on the interior of the 1920 rectangle.
To add new static backgrounds, add a new animation to the "spr_decor" object, - 
and then when placing it into the scene, make its instance variable be the name of the animation. Use the clocks as reference.
Play the game in fullscreen mode. (f11)
Press f4 to close the game immediately.
Added some visual effects to the camera.
Stairs are a bit more complicated, You need 4 objects, 2 stairs and 2 interact buttons. 
(technically you don't need the buttons, but I'm going for consitency) 
You also don't technically need 2 stairs, but then its only one direction. 
To make stair pairs, if going to a new floor that isn't on the level of any other, add the y-coords for the player to be at to the global structure. 
you can get the coords by just moving the player in the editor and checking the properties panel.
Next, set a door and button id to be the same, but the the same as any other pair. Also make sure to set the animation for the staircase.

events.comment:
352 is a number I found by testing numbers until it worked. 347 makes the bottom visible and 357 makes the top visible.
Subtracting 352 to make the camera centered height wise in the room.
uses global MoveSpeed variable, allows us to set it to 0 for cutscenes or something.
Interaction code. makes a "interact" button appear.
